    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected void initialise​(java.lang.String inputString)
      Set the mapping of the rotor based on the parameter.
      void rotate​()
      Rotate the current Rotor.
      void setNextRotor​(Rotor inputRotor)
      Create a reference for the next Rotor in the array, in this object TO BE IMPLEMENTED IN SUBCLASSES
      int substitute​(int inputNumber)
      The number passed as parameter is swapped with a different number by subtracting from it the current position of the rotor,checking if the new number still lies between the range 0-25,using the mapping at the new number, adding the position of the rotor back and checking one more time that the number is in the range 0-25.
      int substituteBack​(int passInteger)
      The number passed as parameter is swapped with a different number by subtracting from it the current position of the rotor,checking if the new number still lies between the range 0-25,using the inverseMapping at the new number, adding the position of the rotor back and checking one more time that the number is in the range 0-25.

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        protected void initialise​(java.lang.String inputString)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the mapping of the rotor based on the parameter. After the mapping is set, do the inverse mapping
        Specified by:
        initialise in class Rotor
        Parameters:
        inputString - the type of the rotor as String
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Invalid Rotor type

      • rotate

        public void rotate​()
        Rotate the current Rotor. The position of the Rotor is stored in a variable called 'position' and if the value of it is less than 25, then just increment it, otherwise set it to 0. At the end, set the new position of the Rotor

      • setNextRotor

        public void setNextRotor​(Rotor inputRotor)
        Create a reference for the next Rotor in the array, in this object TO BE IMPLEMENTED IN SUBCLASSES
        Parameters:
        inputRotor - the next Rotor in the slot

      • substitute

        public int substitute​(int inputNumber)
        The number passed as parameter is swapped with a different number by subtracting from it the current position of the rotor,checking if the new number still lies between the range 0-25,using the mapping at the new number, adding the position of the rotor back and checking one more time that the number is in the range 0-25.
        Parameters:
        inputNumber - the character represented as an integer between 0-25
        Returns:
        int the new character represented as int

      • substituteBack

        public int substituteBack​(int passInteger)
        The number passed as parameter is swapped with a different number by subtracting from it the current position of the rotor,checking if the new number still lies between the range 0-25,using the inverseMapping at the new number, adding the position of the rotor back and checking one more time that the number is in the range 0-25.
        Parameters:
        passInteger - the character represented as an integer between 0-25
        Returns:
        the new character
